jobPostingInfo.title: Systems Engineer III (Integration and Test Engineer)
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) is seeking a Systems Integration & Test Engineer III to join the Instrument Electronics Prototyping, Integration and Test Group and will report to the Group Supervisor. You will be trained and certified in soldering to assemble cables and support any rework that may be needed on electronic boards. And in addition, you will collaborate with internal team members as well as members of other groups such as parts’ procurement and engineering team and the electronics fabrication team.

Tasks include but not limited to:

  • Support a senior engineer in ordering and tracking delivery of electronic parts, issuing and coordinating the fabrication of the printed circuit boards, assist the manufacturing engineer, and monitor and track the assembly of instrument electronics in the manufacturing area.

  • Assist in generating board assembly and build instructions, test plans and procedures, and test instructions.

  • Support testing of prototypes, and engineering and flight electronics boards.

  • Assembles, integrates, tests and validates.

  • Conducts functional and performance testing.

  • Join and contribute to a technical team using development methodologies for the following:

  • Provide supporting documentation and/or procedures for development and operations.

  • Adapt equipment, standards and procedures to accomplish unique measurements.

  • Work with senior engineers on advanced projects and provide status to technical lead(s) and the Group Supervisor.

  • Deliver hardware in accordance with the JPL Deep Space Network standards and guidelines.

  • Assist engineers with procurements of hardware, including creating purchase requisitions, working with JPL Acquisition through the approval process, tracking orders.

  • Update drawings, test procedures, and hardware interface agreements.

  • Provide general lab support.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Systems, Electrical Engineering, or related technical field with 6 years of related experience; Masters with 4 year of related experience; or a PhD with 2 years of related experience.

  • Ability to understand testing requirements and prepare test procedures and test Instructions.

  • Ability to work on multiple subject area tasks.

  • Ability to configure and test digital hardware.

  • Ability to troubleshoot and repair analog and digital circuits using engineering drawings and schematics.

  • Experience with fabrication and assembly of electronics systems, cable harnesses, and test fixtures.

  • Experience testing firmware and software implementations.

  • Ability to follow and understand test instructions.

  • Hands-on experience with test equipment such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, network analyzers, power meters, signal generators.

  • Proficient with computers and Microsoft Office tools.

  • Ability to work independently.

  • Managing manufacturing of electronics board assemblies and cabling in-house or off lab, keeping tasks on schedule and budget

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.

  • Experience working in an ESD safe environment.

Preferred Skills

  • Hands-on experience through senior projects or work-study programs.

  • Experience documenting design and developing test plans and procedure.

  • Prior aerospace industry experience.

  • Knowledge of applicable Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
